meanings.definition: periods of time when a system or machine is not working or available
meanings.sent1: During downtimes, the factory machines are silent and still.
meanings.sent2: The website experiences downtimes late at night for maintenance.
meanings.sent3: The downtimes of the printer always seem to happen when I need it the most.
meanings.sent4: The downtimes of the old clock felt like moments frozen in time.
meanings.sent5: The downtimes of the elevator made everyone take the stairs, creating a mini workout session.

meanings.definition: times when a person is not busy or occupied
meanings.sent1: She enjoys her downtimes by reading books in the cozy corner.
meanings.sent2: Weekends are his downtimes when he can relax and unwind.
meanings.sent3: His downtimes are filled with daydreams and creative thoughts.
meanings.sent4: The downtimes after work are perfect for catching up with friends.
meanings.sent5: In her downtimes, she likes to paint and express her emotions on canvas.
